result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L. Harrison

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Robert L. Harrison
Current: 415 State Road, Rib Lake, WI 54470 United States  (Effective: 04-26-2017)
Prior: 224 S. Second Street, c/o Taylor County Jail, Medford, WI 54451 United States

Defendant Robert L. Harrison in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Defendant Robert L. Harrison in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed.  Information filed.  Waive reading of information.  Plea of no contest.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in counts 2, 3 and 4 and Case No. 15CM64.  Court finds defendant guilty of endangering safety  - count 1.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Paul.  Court withholds sentence and orders three years probation with conditions of court costs; submit DNA sample and DNA surcharge; AODA and follow through with any treatment; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; no contact with P.D. and no entering any taverns.  114 days sentence credit.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Robert L. Harrison in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty requested that the court not forfeit defendant's bond that was previously ordered to be forfeited.  No objection by Attorney Paul.  Court vacates the order for forfeiture of bond.  The original bond is reinstated.  Pretrial conference scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 1:00 pm.  - rt

ADDRESS INFO for Robert L. Harrison
Current: 224 S. Second Street, c/o Taylor County Jail, Medford, WI 54451 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2015)
Prior: 153 W State St., Apt 2, Medford, WI 54451 United States

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $10,000.00 cash bond with conditions of: booking and to not possess or consume alcohol.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested and to begin bond revocation on 15CM64.  Initial appearance set for October 20, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. - ba
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert L. Harrison
Current: 153 W State St., Apt 2, Medford, WI 54451 United States  (Effective: 07-14-2015)
Prior: 153 West State Street #6, Medford, WI 54451

Defendant Robert L. Harrison in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  $500.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with P.G.D. - dob:  2-1-90.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with P.G.D. - dob:  2-1-90.
